intro: Ponerorchis curtipes, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which are typically short-lived. Ponerorchis curtipes is adapted to grow in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
